arm_group.description: The anesthesiologist will administer a proximal nerve block if specified in the randomization envelope.
The anesthesiologist will administer a distal nerve block if specified in the randomization envelope.

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objective of the study is to compare motor strength in knee extension between
      two groups of patients. One group receiving a proximal thigh block of the femoral nerve, and
      one receiving a distal thigh block of the saphenous nerve. The secondary objective is to
      compare the pain relief and functional outcomes in these two groups.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Femoral vs Saphenous Nerve Blocks on Function After ACL Repair

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. Age 18-65

          2. Upcoming ACL reconstruction

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Documented neuropathy

          2. Skeletally immature

          3. Previous knee surgery

          4. Inability to provide informed consent

intervention.description: A nerve block performed as per standard of care: femoral nerve blocks, and saphenous nerve blocks performed more distally (within 10cm superior to the adductor tubercle).

clinical_study.keyword: nerve blocks in Anterior cruciate ligament surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Femoral Versus Saphenous Nerve Blocks on Knee Extensor Strength, Pain, and Patient-Perceived Physical Function Following ACL Reconstruction

primary_outcome.description: Extensor testing will be conducted in both legs using a hand held dynamometer.
primary_outcome.time_frame: change from baseline preoperatively at 12 months

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Penn State Milton S. Hershey Medical Center

secondary_outcome.description: Medical record will be reviewed for type and amount of in hospital post operative medication and levels, then assessed by PROMIS survey at follow up appointments.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: change from in hospital post-operative period at 12 months

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
